author: National Bureau
text:
Women officers to collect info on incidents during Jat agitation

The Haryana government on Friday constituted an all-women inquiry committee to look into allegations of sexual assaults on some women near Murthal in Sonipat district during the Jat agitation.

Director-General of Police Y.P. Singal told journalists in Chandigarh that the three-member committee headed by Deputy Inspector-General Police Rajshree Singh, and two women Deputy Superintendents of Police as its members, would gather information on the alleged incidents on the intervening night of February 22 and 23.

Mr. Singal said these women officers would be available in Sonipat till further orders and information concerning the incidents could be provided to them.

He said the identity of the informer would not be disclosed and the information could be provided to the police or the three-member team round the clock.
title: Panel to study charges of sexual assaults in Murthal
